title: MLB Account - Tapping (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and tries to tap their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then it will not be tappable

title: Entitlements - Anonymous (MLB Internal Regression)
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has completed an in-app purchase
but has not yet linked their purchase, and remains anonymous in the app
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees the My Account section at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see options for "My Teams" and to "Connect Purchase to MLB.com"

title: Set Home Screen Icon (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
custom_expected: Then there will be an option to "Set Home Screen Icon"

title: Set Home Screen Icon - My Teams (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and has team(s) set as "My Teams"
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
and taps the option to "Set Home Screen Icon"
custom_expected: Then there will be a section above the team list for the user's My Teams settings

title: Contents (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and scrolls to the bottom
and taps on "About the MLB app"
custom_expected:
Then the About the MLB app section will open
and the user will be able to find app and device information
and the option to Contact Us

title: Contact Support (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Browse Menu 
and taps to "Contact Support" (under "Help" section)
custom_expected:
Then the user will be re-directed to the MLB Help Center web page with the following fields that need to be completed:

1. Reason for Contact
2. Full Name
3. Email address
4. Phone Number
5. Subject
6. Description
7. Check box with the following disclaimer: "By submitting, I acknowledge..."
8. Submit button (in red)

title: Add password visibility toggle to Login View (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed
* User is currently logged out
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the User Login Page 
And is prompted to enter email and Password
And user enters email 
When the user is ready to enter password and begins typing
custom_expected: Then the user can toggle password visibility on LoginView

title: Password visibility toggle-> Show Password (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed
* User is currently logged out
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the User Login Page
And is prompted to enter email and Password
And the user toggles the "Show Password" option to "on"
When the user types their password
custom_expected: Then the user can see the password being typed

title: Password visibility toggle-> Don't Show Password (Covered by Release Party)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed
* User is currently logged out
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the User Login Page
And is prompted to enter email and Password
And the user toggles the "Show Password" option to "off"
When the user types their password
custom_expected: Then the user will not be able to see the password being typed

title: Rotate to Landscape During Playback
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled for MLB Network
custom_steps:
When the user is playing back the MLB Network stream in Portrait
and the user rotates the device to Landscape
custom_expected:
Then the video will transition into a master-detail style layout similar to what occurs in the PlayList
and the video will continue to play embedded

title: Rotate Back to Portrait During Playback
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled for MLB Network
custom_steps:
When the user is playing back the MLB Network stream
and the device is in Landscape
custom_expected:
Then the video will be re-embedded in the playback area view at the top of the page
and the behavior of the embedded video will be similar to the embedded video playback that occurs in the PlayList

title: Full Screen
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled for MLB Network
custom_steps:
When the user is playing back the MLB Network stream
and taps to bring up the player controls
and taps the Full Screen button
custom_expected:
Then the video will transition to full screen
and playback will be uninterrupted

title: Rotating to Landscape - EDIT
custom_preconds:
Given the user is viewing the MLB Network page in the MLB app
and the device is in Portrait
custom_steps:
When the user rotates the device to Landscape
(when video is not playing)
custom_expected: Then the view will transition into a master-detail style layout similar to what occurs in the PlayList

title: Fresh Install
custom_preconds:
Given the user has fresh installed the app
and is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps: When a user attempts to start up a MLB.TV Stream
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV Stream begins to play successfully

title: Upgrading from Past Build
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed an older version of the app
and upgrades to the newer version
and is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps: When a user attempts to start up a MLB.TV Stream
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV Stream begins to play successfully

title: WiFi Connection
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps: When a user is on WIFI connection and attempts to start up a MLB.TV Stream
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV Stream begins to play successfully

title: Cellular Connection
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps: When a user is on cellular connection and attempts to start up a MLB.TV Stream
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV Stream begins to play successfully

title: User Receives Call
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing an MLB.TV streams
and receives a call during
custom_expected:
Then the MLB.TV Stream will pause
and the user is able to answer the call successfully

title: User Receives a Text
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing an MLB.TV stream
and receives a text message
custom_expected:
Then the MLB.TV Stream will continue to play
and we will receive the Text Message successfully

title: Video Launch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an entitled MLB experience account
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user taps on the selected MLB.tv button located on Scores, Home, and Team Page segments

OR

+ The user taps on a game tile in the Watch Now and Games segments in the Watch section
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will be navigated to the video player of their desired game

title: Successful Playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an entitled MLB experience account
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user taps on the selected MLB.tv button located on Scores, Home, and Team Page segments

OR

+ The user taps on a game tile in the Watch Now and Games segments in the Watch section
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will be navigated to the video player of their desired game

AND

+ Successful playback is observed at the live point if live

OR 

+ Successful playback is observed at the starting point if an archive

title: Closed Captioning On/Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is viewing content using the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping on the player controls option on the video player (Circle with 3 dots on Bottom-right of player)

AND

+ The user selects Subtitles > English or Off or Auto
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user is able to enable closed captions when selecting English

OR

+ No closed captioning is available when selecting Off

OR

+ User's saved selection in their device settings takes precedence when launching and watching media in the app

title: Closed Captioning Enabled From App Settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has enabled CC in their app settings under Account Settings > Accessibility > Closed Captioning (Green = CC On)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Launching a game or other content within the MLB Media Player
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The CC feature will be enabled by default at launch

AND

+ The user will observe closed captions on the video player while viewing

title: Closed Captioning Off From App Settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user does not have CC enabled in their app settings under Account Settings > Accessibility > Closed Captioning (Grey = CC Off)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Launching a game or other content within the MLB Media Player
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The CC feature will be OFF by default at launch

AND

+ The user will NOT observe closed captions on the video player while viewing

title: Device Settings CC On, App Settings CC Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has enabled CC from their device setting's accessibility menu

AND

+ The user does not have CC enabled under the MLB app setting's accessibility menu
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a game or other content within the MLB Media Player
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The Media Player will ignore the device setting's accessibility setting (CC On)

AND

+ The Media player will honor the app setting's accessibility setting (CC Off)

AND

+ Subtitles will not be visible during playback

title: Playback Speed 1.0x
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping on the playback speed button on the bottom-right of the video player when viewing in landscape

OR

+ Tapping on the options button on the bottom-right and selecting the playback speed button within the menu
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The default speed for all video playback will be 1.0x

AND

+ Within this playback speed menu, a check mark will be displayed next to 1.0x

title: Playback Speed - Over 1.0x
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is utilizing the playback speed option within the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Selecting 1.25x, 1.5x, 2.0x
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The playback speed menu will dismiss

AND

+ If the user is not at the live point, the video playback will begin streaming at the desired faster speed

AND

+ If the user is at the live point the playback speed will remain 1.0x speed

title: Playback Speed - Over 1.0x
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is utilizing the playback speed option within the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Selecting 1.25x, 1.5x, 2.0x
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The playback speed menu will dismiss

AND

+ If the user is not at the live point, the video playback will begin streaming at the desired faster speed

AND

+ If the user is at the live point the playback speed will remain 1.0x speed

title: Loading Indicator
custom_preconds: GIVEN an entitled user
custom_steps:
WHEN a user selects a game
AND enters the player
custom_expected: THEN the user is presented with a loading indicator until video plays back or an error occurs

title: Jump To Live
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is viewing a live game, but is not at the live point of the broadcast

AND

+ Taps on the video controls option on the bottom-right of the video player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Selecting "Jump to Live" from the options menu
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will be brought to the live point of the broadcast

AND

+ The Jump to live option will not be available when tapping on the video controls option again

title: Device rotation
custom_preconds: GIVEN  a user in the MLBVideoPlayer stats view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN they turn the phone from portrait to landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the video player must go into fullscreen landscape orientation
AND the fullscreen button option on the player Must go from “Fullscreen” option to “Exit Fullscreen” option

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is in portrait 
AND they select the fullscreen button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the video player must go into fullscreen landscape orientation
AND the fullscreen button option on the player Must go from “Fullscreen” option to “Exit Fullscreen” option

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user is in fullscreen landscape
AND they turn the phone form landscape to portrait
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the player must return to portrait stats view mode

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user is in fullscreen landscape
AND they press the “Exit Fullscreen” icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the player must return to portrait stats view mode

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user selects the Picture in Picture button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the video begins playing in a PiP window at the bottom of the screen
AND the app will be accessible and navigable in the background
AND the app will be locked in Portrait mode
AND the user will be able to manipulate the position of the PiP window

title: Exiting Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an entitled MLB experience account

AND

+ The user has launched a live or archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user taps the back arrow at the top-left of the stats view media player page
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will exit out of the video player for their previously selected game

AND

+ Playback will no longer be heard while navigating the app

title: Debug overlay & Session ID in GAM
custom_preconds:
GIVEN 

+ The user has enabled a session ID overlay on the video player during playback by holding two fingers down on the video player screen for about 7-10 seconds

(Dismiss by doing the same)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN

+ The user observes the overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 

+ The user should see a Conviva session ID as part of the information displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN

+ The user inputs their session ID into Google Ad Manager:

https://admanager.google.com/2605#videocontent/stream_activity_monitor
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN

+ The user can observe info returned by GAM including DAI session and parameter data

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN

+ The user observes the overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN

+ The user should see a 'close' button on the debug overlay

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN 

+ The user taps the 'close' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN

+  the debug overlay view should be dismissed

title: Video Playback with Ads Disabled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an account with an override of VIDEO_ADS_DISABLED

Account: adsDisabled@gmail.com/PasswordDM5

OR

+ The user is signed into an entitled account and locally maps the Media-Gateway call via Proxy with "adsEnabled": false
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user attempts to launch media playback of a game
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Playback is successful

AND

+ A timed out error is not displayed at launch

title: Advertisements
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an entitled MLB experience account

AND

+ The user has launched a live or archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN

The game has gone into a stoppage time:

- Mid-inning or end-of-inning Ad break
- Pitching change
- Pre-game
- Post-game
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will observe advertisements playing in TV and stream breaks

AND

+ The user will observe the ad break ending before gameplay is resumed

AND

+ The user will observe that the ad break does not begin early before on-field gameplay has stopped.

title: 10-Sec RW and FF
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a game in the MLBMediaPlayer
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Utilizing the 10-second Fast-forward and Rewind overlay buttons on the video player
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The video playback will fast-forward by 10 seconds with the time elapsed and time remaining code updating on the scrubber

OR

+ The video playback will rewind by 10 seconds with the time elapsed and time remaining code updating on the scrubber

title: Play/Pause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game in the MLBMedia Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping the play symbol or pause symbol button in-between FF/RW quick-action buttons in the middle of the video player
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Video playback in a playing state will display the pause symbol

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14525324)


OR

+ Video playback in a paused state will display the play symbol

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14525325)

title: Maximize Video Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game in the MLBMedia Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Selecting the maximize button at the top-left of the video player (two arrows) in portrait view

OR

+ Selecting the maximize button at the top-left of the video player (two arrows) when the phone is rotated to landscape view
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The video player will move to a portrait, wide-screen view

AND

+ Rotating the device to landscape will move the video player to full-screen view

OR

+ The video player will move from landscape stats view to full-screen video playback

title: Minimize Video Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game in the MLBMedia Player

AND

+ The user is playing back the game in landscape full-screen view or portrait wide-screen view
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping the X in the top-left of the video player
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The video player should return to the embedded player view in the stats page

title: Picture-in-Picture
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is watching the a game in the MLBtv player

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects the Picture in Picture button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the video begins playing in a PiP window at the bottom of the screen
AND the app will be accessible and navigable in the background
AND the app will be locked in Portrait mode
AND the user will be able to manipulate the position of the PiP window

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user is watching a game in PiP mode
AND the user launches another game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the PiP window will be dismissed
AND the new game will launch in the player in the stats view
AND all the general expected behavior of the player will function

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user is watching a game in PiP mode
AND the user selects the full screen button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the game will return to the player in the stats view
AND all the general expected behavior of the player will function

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user is watching a game in PiP mode
AND the user actions the controls (Pause/Play, forward 10, back 10)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video feed in the PiP window will respond accordinglyWHEN

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user is watching a game in PiP mode
AND the user selects the X button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the PiP window will be dismissed
AND the user will be presented with wherever they have navigated in the background

title: Video Feeds
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game in the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping on the Teams drop-down in the center of the video player overlay
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The broadcast options menu will have a title copy of "Select Feeds"

AND

+ The user will observe the current feed playing back is checked off

AND

+ The user may select the alternative team's video broadcast to successfully launch play back for another feed

AND

+ The Audio feed options will be hidden until the user utilizes the arrow to collapse the menu items

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14525327)

title: Audio Feeds
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game in the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping on the Teams drop-down in the center of the video player overlay
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The broadcast options menu will have a title copy of "Select Feeds"

AND

+ The Audio feed options will be hidden until the user utilizes the arrow to collapse the menu items

AND

+ The user can successfully select alternate audio feeds from the options and verify playback of the expected stream

AND

+ The current audio feed playing will be checked off in the audio broadcast options menu

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14525328)

title: National Video Feed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived national game in the MLB Media Player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Tapping on the Teams drop-down in the center of the video player overlay
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The broadcast options menu will have a title copy of "Select Feeds"

AND

+ The user will observe one national video broadcast checked off under the video feed options

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14525329)

title: TV Button - Portrait
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
and the device is in Portrait
custom_steps:
When the user launches an MLB.TV stream
and taps the TV button
custom_expected:
Then an audio feed picker will display as a menu on the bottom of the screen
and will include a "Done" button in the top right of the menu

title: TV Button - Landscape
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
and the device is in Landscape
custom_steps:
When the user launches an MLB.TV stream
and taps the TV button
custom_expected:
Then the audio feed picker will display across the whole screen
and the "Done" button will be visible and accessible

title: Audio Feed Picker Display
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps:
When the user launches an MLB.TV stream
and taps the TV button to display the audio feed picker
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the following:
	
Titled "Select Feeds"
Separated into two categories: Video Feed, Audio Feed
Video Feed section will list: Away team's feed (top), Home team's feed (bottom)
Audio Feed section will list only one team's audio options (that whose TV feed is currently playing): TV audio, English Radio audio, Spanish radio audio (if available)

title: Audio Feed Picker - Current Audio
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps:
When the user launches an MLB.TV stream
and taps the TV button to display the audio feed picker
custom_expected:
The user will see two button indicators for which audio is currently playing:

one for the video feed
one for the audio feed

title: Audio Feed Picker - Switching Audio (Radio)
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps:
When the user launches an MLB.TV stream
and taps the TV button to display the audio feed picker
and picks another audio feed option (Radio)
custom_expected:
Then the TV stream will remain the same,
and the audio will switch over to the Radio audio feed,
and the button indicator will update to reflect the new option

title: Audio Feed Picker - Switching Audio (Video)
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps:
When the user launches an MLB.TV stream
and taps the TV button to display the audio feed picker
and picks another audio feed option (Video)
custom_expected:
Then the user will go through media framework checks,
and will be switched over to the other video feed

title: Audio Feed Picker - New Feed
custom_preconds: Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
custom_steps: When the user has switched to another video feed via the audio feed picker
custom_expected: Then the user can tap the TV button to bring up the audio feed picker again

title: Audio Feed Picker - New Feed Options
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
and the user has switched to another video feed via the audio feed picker
custom_steps: When the user taps the TV button to view the audio feed picker
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the same Video Feed options (away/home),
but will see different TV and Radio Audio Feed options, specific to the team whose TV feed is playing

title: Audio Feed Picker - Done Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV
and the user is viewing the audio feed picker
custom_steps: When the user taps the Done button
custom_expected: Then the feed picker will be dismissed

title: Audio Feed Picker - Spanish user
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged in with an account entitled for MLB.TV

AND

+ The device language is set to Spanish
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches an MLB.TV feed of a team that also has a Spanish MLB Audio feed available
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The appropriate TV feed will play

AND

+ The Spanish Audio Feed will play 

AND

+ The Spanish Radio Audio Feed will be shown as selected in the broadcast options.

title: Favorited Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged in with an entitled MLB.tv account

AND

+ The user has a favorited team selected
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Launching the favorited team's live game stream from the scores, watch or home tab
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The game broadcast of the favorited team (Home or Away) should play back

AND

+ The team's TV audio feed (Home or Away) should play back

title: Followed Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged in with an entitled MLB.tv account

AND

+ The user has a followed team selected
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Launching the followed team's live game stream from the scores, watch or home tab
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The TV broadcast of the followed  team (Home or Away) should play back

AND

+ The team's TV audio feed (Home or Away) should play back

title: Device Language - Spanish
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has their device language set to Spanish

AND

+ The user is logged into an entitled MLB.tv account
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a live or archived game feed
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The home team's TV broadcast will begin playback

AND

+ The home team's Alternate Audio Spanish broadcast will begin playback

title: Default Feed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an entitled MLB.tv account

AND

+ The user does not have their device language localized to spanish

AND

+ The user does not have a favorited or followed team
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a live or archived game feed
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The home team's video broadcast should begin playback

AND

+ The home team's audio broadcast should begin playback

title: Non-Entitled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is not logged into an entitled MLB.tv account for video playback (Free user)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user attempts to launch a tv broadcast feed (Scores, Watch, Home)
custom_expected:
THEN

+ A paywall will be displayed

AND

+ The user will be unable to receive video playback

AND

+ The user will not be navigated to the Audio EPG

title: Single-Team Launch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an account that has single-team entitlements (EX: DM5cubs)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a game featuring the single-team
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The single-team's video broadcast should begin playback (Home or Away)

title: Single-Team Launch Non-Entitled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is logged into an account that has single-team entitlements (EX: DM5cubs)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a regular season game where that team is NOT participating in.
custom_expected:
THEN

+ A paywall will be displayed

title: Video Player Alternate Feed Launch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has entered a video broadcast

AND

+ The user taps on the broadcast options within the video player
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user selects the alternate video broadcast (AWAY or HOME)
custom_expected:
THEN

+ If entitled, the other video broadcast stream should begin playback

OR

+ If the user is not entitled, an entitlement error  should display

OR

+ If the user is blacked out, a blackout message should display

title: Single-Team International User Postseason Launch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN 

+ The user is logged into an single-team entitled account

AND

+ The user is located outside of the US and Canada
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a live or archived MLB postseason game
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will receive immediate playback without a blackout message or mvpd flow

title: Hide Scores Enabled - Live Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has enabled Hide Scores in their app settings

AND

+ The user launches a game in-progress
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ A broadcast start milestone has been established
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The video playback will begin at the broadcast start and NOT at the live point

Note: If a broadcast milestone is not established yet, playback should begin at the start of the warmup slate.

title: Hide Scores Enabled - Archived Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has enabled Hide Scores in their app settings

AND

+ The user launches a game that is final (Archived)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a game that is final (Archived) from any launch point in the app
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Media playback should begin at the start of game broadcast (Warm up slate should be trimmed out at this point)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the News tab at the bottom and taps on the Videos segment
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB Video index will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user scrolls through the video section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will briefly see a placeholder icon for each video before the video's thumbnail loads

**May need to throttle connection using Charles Proxy

custom_steps_separated.content: When we are on the MLB or team specific videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the vides are accurate and pertinent to the team selected

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Video tab and scrolls down the videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be limited to a maximum of the most recent 30 videos

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the News tab at the bottom and taps on the Videos segment
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to see a full page of video highlights

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the News tab at the bottom and taps on the Videos segment
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have access to the Team Selector filter

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user examines the contests of a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the thumbnail will contain a title in white bolded font
and the time/date stamp will be below the the title
and will contain an info button in the top right corner
and a share button on the bottom right corner
and all text present will be clear and legible

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user pulls down the section below the Top Stories/Videos segmented controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then iOS pull to refresh will be exposed with circle animation (similar to native iOS Mail App) and the videos section will refresh with the most current video in the index at top

title: Team Filter (Possibly Stale)
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the MLB button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the Team Selector/Filter

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the MLB button
and is brought to the Team Selector/Filter
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see a Filter modal with a Done button
And then below see a MLB filter
then Postseason News (if applicable)
then Favorite Team(s)
then the rest of the teams (and logos) will be listed in their appropriate divisions in alphabetical order

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a team from the Team Selector/Filter
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see the highlights index specific to the team
and the MLB filter button will be converted to a functioning button with the team's name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user adds or removes a Favorite Team from the More section and then accesses the Team Selector/Filter on the Videos tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the changes made in the More section should be reflected in the Team Selector/Filter for Favorite Teams

title: Playback
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then video will play inline

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user plays an inline video and scrolls the video index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video continues to play inline
and can be viewed when scrolling back to that highlight

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user plays a video and turns the iPhone landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will play in Full screen mode

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user plays a video inline
and turns the iPhone to landscape
and the video plays in Full Screen
and then the user rotates the device back to portrait
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video returns to inline playback

custom_steps_separated.content: On WIFI connection, when the user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video playback for the selected highlight will begin

custom_steps_separated.content: On Carrier connection, when the user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video playback for the selected highlight will begin

title: Video Controls
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will begin to play inline
and the video will be muted by default

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the video during inline playback
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will unmute

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the video a second time during inline playback
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video controls will be presented on the screen 

Top Overlay: X button Title, AirPlay, Chromecast
Bottom Overlay: Play/Pause, Elapsed (M:SS), Scrubber, Remaining (M:SS), Toggle Full Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a video during inline playback
and taps on Toggle Full Screen button on the bottom overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will play in Full screen mode

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user plays a video in full screen mode in landscape mode and taps on the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video controller UI will appear onscreen with the following:

Top Overlay: X button, Title, AirPlay, Chromecast
Bottom Overlay: Play/Pause, Elapsed (M:SS), Scrubber, Remaining (M:SS), Toggle Full Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is connected to the same network as a Chromecast 
and then plays a video 
and then taps the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a Chromecast icon on the top overlay of the video controller

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is connected to the same network as an Apple TV 
and then plays a video 
and then taps the screen

disableAirplay is set to false in AppConfig
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an Apple TV icon on the top overlay of the video controller

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing a inline video 
and then holds down the dot on the scrubber
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will stop
and the Play button will turn to a Pause button
and the user is able to move the scrubber back and forward

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is playing an inline video and then moves the scrubber dot to advance the video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will stop and then start again at the point where the video was scrubbed

Test moving the scrubber back and forth

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is playing a video in fullscreen and then holds down the dot on the scrubber
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will stop
and the Play button will turn to a Pause button
and the user is able to move the scrubber back and forward

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is playing a video in full screen and moves the scrubber dot to advance the video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will stop and then start again and the point where the video was scrubbed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is playing a video inline and taps the Mute button in the top overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will either mute or unmute, depending on the intended functionality

title: Pull to Close
custom_preconds: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-18853

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched a video highlight 
and it is playing in full-screen mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should still see the X at the top left corner
and tapping it should still close the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched a video highlight that is playing in-line
and tries to swipe down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video highlight should not dismiss 
and it should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched and MLB.TV feed
and tries to swipe down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV feed should not dismiss
and it should continue to play

title: Interstitial Between Videos
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode and the video finishes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the video interstitial in between videos
and X button in the upper left
and Play Again button
and Play Next Video button
and Next video will begin <number> text
and next highlight will automatically start

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and taps on the X button in the upper left
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the interstitial will close
and the user is returned to the Video index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and taps on the Play Again button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the interstitial will close
and previous video will play again

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and taps on the Play Next Video button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the interstitial will close
and next video will play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and user observes the Next video will begin <number> text
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see <number> count down
and then interstitial will close
and the video will play

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode and the video finishes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the next highlight will begin to play automatically (Lite users may see preroll)
and will continue until the end of that particular index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an admin has turned on the sharing kill switch and a user plays an inline video and taps the screen

"shouldKillVideoSharing": true,
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not be able to share the video

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into Twitter (but Twitter is installed) and taps on the Share button on the video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the pop up bubble will appear and the user will see the Twitter icon as an option to choose

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is logged into Twitter and taps on the Share button on the video thumbnail and Tweet button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Tweet screen will appear onscreen

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Share button on the video thumbnail and taps on Tweet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the tweet sheet should appear
and the format should display the title of the video
and the last line should be the actual link to the video, but it will only appear on the actual tweet, not the tweet sheet

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into Facebook (but Facebook is installed) and taps on the Share button on the video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Facebook icon in the pop up bubble

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is logged into Facebook and taps on the Share button on the video thumbnail and then taps on the Facebook button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Post to Wall page will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the share button on the video thumbnail and then taps on Post to Facebook
custom_steps_separated.expected:
When the user Then the Facebok Post to Wall page will appear
and the actual post will display the video thumbnail
and caption followed by www.mlb.com

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has an e-mail account setup on a phone and taps on a Share button on the video thumbnail and then e-mail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then device's native email client will open an email form

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Share button on a video thumbnail and then e-mail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the e-mail draft will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is playing a video and taps on the Share button on the video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a New Message screen will appear and once the message is sent it will be formatted with just a video link that will push on the MLB Video site

title: Preroll Ads
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Lite user taps to play a video highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a preroll ad will play, followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing the preroll ad that is playing
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
"Learn more" button in top right
Ad duration counter in bottom left

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a preroll ad
and taps on "Learn more"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview for the ad

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a preroll ad
and views the ad duration counter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the number of ads will be correct and counter will count down properly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a preroll ad
and taps anywhere on the video player (not the X or Learn more)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the preroll ad will pause

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a preroll ad that is paused
and taps again on the player
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the preroll ad will resume playback

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a Lite user taps to play a video highlight
on a carrier connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a preroll ad will play, followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a Lite user taps to play a video highlight
on a Wifi connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a preroll ad will play, followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content: When a paid user taps to play a video highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should not see a preroll ad

title: Upgrading App (Retaining Feature Access/Settings)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the current Store build version installed from the App Store
And the user has logged in with an entitled account
And the user has set Favorite Team(s)
custom_steps:
When the user overwrites the app with the latest TestFlight Build
And launches the app
custom_expected:
Then the user's login information will be retained
And the user's feature access will be retained
And the user's Favorite Teams will be retained

title: MLB.tv - Switching Feeds
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iPhone and iPad
custom_steps:
When a user is watching an MLB.TV video
and has the OOTSB overlay displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a the other feed of the game

Check on iPhone and iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the user is let into the other feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a feed that is blacked out

Check on iPhone and iPad

(during in-season only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the blackout message appears

custom_steps_separated.content:
and single team user taps on a the other feed of the game

Check on iPhone and iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the single team message appears restricting them from watching the feed

custom_steps_separated.content: and Audio user is on a Free Game of the Day feed and switches to a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: in Portrait: Then the user is prompted with the TV paywall

title: Gameday - Switching Games
custom_preconds: Given a user has MLB app installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in Gameday
and switches between games in the OOTSB (iPad)
or switches between games on the Scoreboard (iPad/iPhone)

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and another live game
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches final game and a game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

title: Lite User Gating
custom_preconds: Given a Lite user opens MLB app
custom_steps: Then the user should see the following when they perform the action

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on the Audio (headphones) button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees an Audio Paywall
with Monthly and Yearly options

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on MLB.TV (TV) button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees a MLB.TV Premium Upsell Banner
and tapping on it launches the MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees a MLB.TV Paywall
with current location check message

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees Login and Register webview
and they can play the feed after going through flow

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a game cell on the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees Gameday with 
ad placements
stadium and batter image
Pitch by Pitch data

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on Gameday > Videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees highlights w/ preroll ad

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps between tabs in the app (News, Videos, Standings)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees ads

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on More
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees an Audio upsell button
and tapping launches the Audio paywall

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone (PT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to London or Tokyo and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone. Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to 24 hour time and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data loads
And the app does not crash

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the MLB Network page via the More Menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the schedule will load and be displayed in Eastern Time, regardless of the user's timezone

title: Close Account Page
custom_preconds: * User is logged in with an active account
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the Account page
When the user clicks "Close Account"
And the user is brought to the "Request Account Deletion Page" 
And the User inputs their email and password
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to a page confirming the user wants to delete their account

title: User Closes Account
custom_preconds: * User first completes this test case C28961221
custom_steps:
Given the user selects the "Continue to Account Deletion"
When the user confirms they want their account deleted
custom_expected:
Then the user will be sent an email confirming they want to delete their account 
And the user will follow the link to delete their account 
And the users account will be deleted

title: Standings -> Page Opens From Bottom Nav Bar
custom_preconds: * user is on the home page
custom_steps:
Given the user is on the home page
When the user clicks "Standings"
custom_expected: The Standings page opens

title: Standings -> Favorite Team Selected and is on the Divisional tab
custom_steps: Given a user has a favorite team selected and is on the Divisional tab
custom_expected: Then the favorite team appears highlighted

title: Standings -> User Has a Favorite Team Selected and it is on the Divisional tab
custom_steps: Given the user has a favorite team selected and it is on the Divisional tab
custom_expected: Then the division of the favorite team is on top

title: Scoreboard Refresh
custom_preconds:
* Ensure user is on latest build
* Ensure live game is being played or game can be strung
custom_steps:
Given a live game is being played
And a user navigates to to Scores Tab
When a user taps a game cell to launch Gameday
And then returns to Scoreboard from Gameday
custom_expected: Then scoreboard should refresh and then continue to poll every 15 number of seconds without having to close and re-open the app

title: Onboarding - Signup from Welcome Screen
custom_steps:
Given that user is on welcome screen
Then user should be able to sign up to MLB
and favorite teams and players should be stored in midfield.

custom_steps_separated.content: Open MLB app.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Open MLB app.

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on signup button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Signup screen should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Enter all mandatory fields with valid data, then click on continue.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Success screen should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on continue button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Onboarding flow should be started.

custom_steps_separated.content: Follow any team and players, then finish the onboarding flow.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Home page should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings and validate username and logout buttons are displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Username and logout button should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings > My players and teams, Then validate that followed teams and players in step 5 are displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Teams and players followed should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Open MLB app.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Welcome Screen should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Enter username and password then click on login.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Onboarding should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Finish onboarding flow following any team and players.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Home page should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings page.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Validate username and logout button are displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings > My players & teams and validate that teams and players followed in step 3 are displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Teams and players followed are displayed correctly.
